author: Blue_25
title: Patient confidentiality
body:
I feel upset, embarrassed and very dismissed at bringing up the lack of privacy afforded to me as a day patient in Stobhill Hospital.  
The nurse who checked me in had obviously not read my notes. The pain relief procedure I was admitted for is directly related to a serious operation and the nurse appeared not to be aware of this. I tried to explain as quietly as possible (through a mask), I felt the nurse didn’t do the same and as the other 3 patients (who were all silent) will have heard.  
To make matters worse, I’m fairly sure that I knew the patient in the bed beside me, albeit vaguely and not directly. I brought up my distress at being forced to relate my medical history with no privacy. The nurse apologised and said they couldn’t possibly read all my history. I can’t accept this as my procedure is related to a specific issue discussed at a consultation within the last 9 months. This would have been documented in my notes.  
I was offered a feedback form which I declined at that time. The nurse also offered to convey my concerns to the team, however, didn’t offer me the opportunity to speak to the nurse in charge.  
I felt my comments were dismissed, that I was being picky and unreasonable & then the nurse left.  
For the next 15 minutes I had to endure the staff whispering amongst themselves about the nurse being upset and crying in the corridor. The other patients would also have have been aware of this. When I was being prepared for my procedure the nurse involved was someone else. They were polite and courteous but that’s all. They barely made eye contact. No one asked me if I was ok. I felt like walking out.  
The procedure and post procedure care was really good. To be fair, the nurse who had prepared me seemed to have thawed a bit by the time I came back to the bay and was more chatty.  
My discharge was uneventful and I was relieved to be leaving.  
Curtains are not walls and some patients will value privacy more than others. If any discussion involves sensitive information this should be made clear and the offer of privacy made. I know It’s a pain and I’m aware that these spaces are hard to find. It doesn’t take away from the fact that patient care should include the opportunity to speak freely and privately should the situation.

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

author: Bella82
title: Communication problems
body: After battling with my mental health, it took a decline recently. I Managed to voice some what I thought were unspeakable things which were intrusive thoughts to my care co-ordinate. I ended up under home treatment team. I'm thankful for the support but I believe this service needs looking at. For reasons like communication for example; they said they would ring me but not doing so and just turning up at my home. They missed a day to call me also I would be waiting all day for them to call which ended up being late in the day. Struggling and not knowing if I would have any support that day was really distressing of being in the unknown. I hope this feedback will be helpful and hopefully no distress is caused to others.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust
Healthwatch Sheffield
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
NHS Sheffield ICB

author: oldlady
title: Never really saw any nursing staff
body: It feels like this ward is the dumping ward of the hospital. Never really saw any nursing staff, just a wonderful healthcare assistant. Again never saw the same doctor twice and each one changed their diagnosis. When my daughter questioned diagnosis and treatment she was told she was being aggressive (seems you cannot ask about or question decision). Visitors told their allocated visiting slot to avoid covid, yet, patients who are able, get into lift and meet family/friends in the Costa coffee shop. I almost had tests for the patient who had been discharged from my bed. I was admitted with pneumonia, still trying to work out why I had tests for gall stones and got diagnosed with an overactive bladder? (which I dont have). Discharged after 2 days as fit with some antibiotics.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

author: Evansj
title: Outstanding care
body:
I spoke to Richard a trauma co-ordinator at the Queen Victoria hospital for advice.  
He went above and beyond to help my partner receive the care he needed. He showed so much compassion and care to a patient.  
He is a role model for what the NHS stand for.  
Amazing man  
Thank you

readBy.name: Queen Victoria Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: jbridge
title: Out of Hours GP
body:
I went online for advice about a long running fever on Saturday lunchtime and was advised to contact Out of Hours GPs which I did.  
I was told to expect a call within 2 hours but this did not come through for more than 6 hours at which point I was asleep and too slow to answer the phone so it went to voicemail promising a further attempt within 2 hours. That's the down side - I think it would be good to have 2 attempts at a call rather than have to wait 2 more hours but I'm sure that there are operational reasons for this. And this is not a complaint, but an observation.  
When the second call came in late evening from a different doctor she was concerned that I needed to be seen and after a thorough phone consultation she tried to see if I could be seen in the Town clinic. When she phoned back she said it was closing and I wouldn't be able to get there in time so organised a home visit. I thought this was great.  
When the visit eventually happened at about 3AM it was a very professional and startlingly alert (for the time of day) nurse practitioner who made a thorough examination got me straight on a regular dosage for paracetamol and ibuprofen (which I'd been completely under dosing hitherto) and gave me clear advice. She was excellent.  
So thank you to those concerned (sorry didn't catch any names, brain numb) and don't let anyone criticise an excellent service which we should be grateful to have.

readBy.name: Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust

author: taurus57
title: Hysteroscopy - pain control
body:
My GP suspected I may have womb cancer so organised an appointment at another doctors surgery. I was just told 'it would be like a smear'. The pain was horrendous, I thought I was going to pass out. The doctor and nurse were both telling me to keep still as they would not get the cells that were needed to allow diagnosis and we wouldn't want to do this again, would we?.  
I considered myself to be rather stoic regarding surgeries etc as I had 2 previous c-sections and a gyn. op before that. I stood up feeling very wobbly and blood just gushed out of me, I was pointed to the dressing room and told to dress and wait to be given a pad. I left after being told to have some paracetamol when I got home.  
I had to phone my husband at work to come and get me as I knew I couldn't drive home. I had to see GP the next day as I was still bleeding profusely. I later discovered that with my gyn. history ( no vaginal births) I should not have been treated this way, I should have been offered a GA.

readBy.name: Sheffield University Medical School 2021

author: WMcCrae
title: Excellent care
body:
I would like to take this opportunity to thank all the Nurses and Doctors that attended to my father in ward C6. Your professionalism and sympathetic manner was of great comfort to me and my family and without doubt something others should aspire to emulate.  
In circumstances far from normal, nothing was to much trouble, we will be forever in your debt.

readBy.name: NHS Dumfries and Galloway

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My experience in A&E and Orthopaedics
body:
I don't have very much history of being in hospital as I thankfully haven't had any reason seek care for over 40 years, until last week. I fell down two steps and was in immense pain, everyone around me was trying to get me back up but I knew I had injured myself really badly so an ambulance was called. I was surprised that the ambulance arrived so quickly. I was so pleased with the lady and gentleman who were looking after me, they made sure immediately that I was comfortable and was receiving pain relief as they too could see how bad my fall was. In the ambulance the staff reassured me and made me feel like I was in safe hands, I was extremely content with the care I was receiving.  
As my fall happened in Newry, the ambulance was contemplating taking me to Daisy Hill first, but after an evaluation in the ambulance they made the decision to take me straight over to Craigavon as it was believed that an operation was necessary. I am so impressed with how proactive the staff were and their knowledge to make that decision was really beneficial for my treatment.  
When I arrived at Craigavon I was admitted through A&E and my experience was actually very pleasant. I was seen very quickly and the staff were so efficient. I felt very informed and knew that staff were going out of their way to ensure that everything was being communicated to me well, and in a way which I was able to understand. After a short wait in A&E and a quick overall examination it was decided that I was going to need an operation, I felt involved in this decision and knew that the doctors were actively listening to my opinion. Before I was taken in for the operation, I met and got chatting to my surgeon. He was a lovely gentleman who made sure to address all my worries and chatted through all my fears with regards to the operation. He reassured me as he chatted through the procedure and made sure I was aware of what the operation would entail. After our discussion I felt that I was left informed and relived that I was in such good hands.  
Now back on the ward to recover I am extremely content with my surroundings. The environment here on this orthopaedics ward is very pleasant and I'm finding it is making my recovery so much easier.  
Everything is so clean and sanitary and I know during the current pandemic era, here I am not at any risk of contracting COVID during my recovery. I am also very relieved to see all the staff kitted out in appropriate PPE and ensuring to sanitize before and after interacting with me. The food is very nice and I am left feeling full and satisfied after any meal I receive. My room is nice and bright, I feel like I'm in a hotel.  
The staff have communicated everything throughout my recovery so far very well and they have been so accommodating in terms of their communication to me as I need hearing aids to hear properly, but I often forget to charge them so the staff have started to remind me. I have found it really difficult without being able to have any visitors in during my recovery and at times this had made me feel isolated and alone, but the care staff have been brilliant at brightening my mood and have told me about the virtual visiting service offered here which I am planning to start using.  
One thing I would suggest an improvement on is the hospital beds, I find the mattress very rubbery and uncomfortable especially after my operation when I have been in a good bit of pain. Other than this my experience has been outstanding so just a huge thanks to all the staff who have helped me recover.

readBy.name: Northern Ireland ambulance service
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Treyj95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My experience in Craigavon Hospital on the Orthopaedic ward
body:
I have waited 3 weeks for an operation and this has felt like a lifetime. I have been in a lot of pain at home so when I got the phone call to say that my operation would go ahead and there was an available appointment, I felt very relieved. The wait was difficult and this was the most negative part of my experience. I have been in a lot of pain at home and felt very down not knowing when I would get a date for my operation. It was difficult to cope with the pain at home and I think the health system fails people like me during those three weeks of pain. I felt quite abandoned and as if I had to just get on with my discomfort and deal with it.  
I completely understand this is the fault of the health system and its issues of being understaffed and under resourced. I was waiting to get a piece of metal put in my leg and once I arrived in the hospital all of my annoyance and pain was overshadowed as I knew I was in the hands of caring individuals who were going to prioritise helping me get back up on my feet.  
I got a relative to leave me up to the hospital and this was very straightforward. There were no issues with parking etc. I wasn't sure where the orthopaedic ward was so when I arrived in reception I asked the staff there and they were able to direct me. They were all very helpful and welcoming. The staff on the orthopaedic ward have been marvellous. I feel comfortable and rested.  
What I would commend the staff the most for would be their communication skills with me and how thorough they have been with their explanations. It is always a daunting experience to undergo a surgical procedure and at least when nursing staff and doctors talk you through everything you feel like you can prepare better for the procedure. I always knew what treatment they were giving me and why they were doing it and this really reassured me and put me at ease before my operation. They answered questions that I had and if they were unsure of an answer they always came back to me. I am extremely impressed with the staff in Craigavon Hospital and would feel very happy to come again knowing how polite and accommodating the staff are.  
Overall my ward space is extremely comfortable. I am lucky that I have been given a side room which is great as I get my own privacy and a TV. The presence of the TV really helps to pass the time. The room is very clean and the toilet and showering facilities are of the same high standard of cleanliness.  
Apart from my issues with waiting I have no complaints about the quality of my care in Hospital. It was my first time in Craigavon Hospital and the standard of care has been so good I will be returning here in the future if I ever have another health problem.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: JBoy
title: Warm and friendly
body: I was admitted to Surgical Ward 2 after spending a few hours in A& E.   I had been in a lot of pain and wasn't feel very well.   All the staff were very professional and I was treated in a warm and friendly way.   The food was five star and all the staff, without exception, were attentive and helpful, putting me at ease.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: shuddertd76
title: Quick and painless
body: I received my first Covid-19 vaccination at the age of seventeen. The staff were extremely pleasant and quickly put me at ease. The process was quick and painless and all information about the vaccination was thoroughly explained.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Grateful to be in capable hands
body: After breaking one of my arms and a thigh bone and coming out of my operation to recover here, I am very content with my time on this ward. The staff are all so kind, from the cleaners to the surgeons I can't fault an experience with any of them, I feel so grateful to be in such capable hands. The skill and knowledge of the medical and nursing teams is admirable and I am reassured that the treatment I am now receiving in my recovery is the best I will get. The staff have such an upbeat attitude towards their job, and their ability to work within team to provide the best care for patients is outstanding. I feel like I get more than enough pain relief as I am comfortable and content pain wise. Any time I call for any help no matter what the issue, staff are willing to help, I feel listened to and understood by the nursing team which has been very beneficial in my recovery.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Joanneb123
title: Chemotherapy treatment
body: I have been receiving chemotherapy treatment in the University Monklands hospital and I must say the support and guidance I’ve been given by nurses Lorna and Annemarie in ward 15 has been nothing short of amazing. They have both made this journey for me much easier by explaining each stage of my treatment whilst helping me to manage any symptoms that has occurred, they are always at the end of the phone and on one occasion I had to be admitted to hospital and they helped to arrange my admission and were waiting for me to arrive in A& E to ensure I was settled in. I cannot thank them enough for everything they have done for me these last few months, at one of the most difficult times of my life they have given me the most fantastic strength and support, they are exceptional nurses and a true credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde
NHS Lanarkshire
Partnership for Change

author: health_90
title: Coil removal
body: The nurse who saw me today made me instantly feel at ease and kept me calm even though we couldn’t find the strings she told me what I needed to do she gave some great advice professional and friendly. She maintained my dignity throughout the procedure.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: bracehb53
title: Smoking at the new hospital
body:
Constantly see patients/visitors and staff smoking in the grounds despite signage stating that NHS property are smoke-free, appreciate this may have slipped during coranavirus however spoke to a patient who was smoking in a chair in front of main entrance. Yip their choice to continue to smoke, not my choice to have to walk through the smoke. Why are staff and managers doing nothing about it?  
Either that or take the false claim signs down.  
Smoke coming oot my ears with this one.

readBy.name: NHS Dumfries and Galloway

author: Ted0
title: Deeply reassuring
body:
I was recently referred to the department and was very nervous to go, especially with the extreme difficulties surrounding Covid 19. I have to say that the minute I arrived, every member of staff that I spoke to put me at my ease. Having already spent eighteen months working through this, the professionalism and kindness were outstanding and deeply reassuring. I was made fully aware of the procedures, and possible further steps in a positive and comprehensive way and made to feel safe.Any fears were eased by the efficient and practical attitude of the staff, and a genuine understanding of the patient’s concerns was made – which I am sure is the experience of anyone attending the department. All that, and on a daily basis, all year round.  
I cannot thank them enough and send my best wishes.

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley

author: Shell 08
title: Amazing service
body: I took my husband into A& E after an Ambulance was unavailable to arrive for 45 mins! ! This prompted me to take my husband myself as I knew he was having a heart attack! ! ! ! When we arrived we were taken in quickly and my husband was put on a heart monitor to which the doctor told me he was having a heart attack, then everyone went into fast prompt action of pain relief & medication and calls to Broadgreen hospital we were kept informed at every stage. Then an ambulance crew arrived to take him to the other hospital for his emergency procedure I really have to thank all the staff for there brilliant care given to both my husband & myself.

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
North West Ambulance Service NHS Trust

author: Gettingbetter
title: Treated with respect
body:
I was admitted to the Forth Valley Royal Hospital for a Colonoscopy and Endoscopy. Not a great prospect as you can imagine. I was admitted by Nurse Donalda and was treated with every respect and made to feel very relaxed and prepared for the treatment. I was then introduced to Diane who would carry out the procedure assisted by Roseann and Vicky. Every member of this team helped to make me feel relaxed and the procedure went without a hitch.  
If looking for an improvement it wont be found in the care I had during this procedure. It serves to remind me of the very high standard of care I have had during the last few years in my treatment for cancer, I am still here to tell the story.

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley

author: Lorr27
title: COVID 19 pop up clinic Newry
body:
My 15 year old son whom has autism received his first vaccine today, he has a fear off needles and his anxiety levels upon arrival were through the roof, the team at the quays were fantastic with him especially Phil all I can say is what an amazing woman she is she was so patient with him.  
I honestly couldn’t praise this woman enough.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Greenie1967
title: Post-operative care
body:
I was recently admitted to Aberdeen Royal Infirmary to undergo surgery at short notice to insert a metal plate to hold my broken clavicle together. Although I was only in for one night, I was really impressed by the care I received from all the staff on Ward 212. I was kept informed all the way through by different staff members and every person I saw - nurses, junior doctors, consultants, etc - were professional and friendly and this helped me remain calm for what was my first surgical procedure. In particular, I had 2 nurses who looked after me - Daisy during the day shift and another nurse whose name I didn't catch unfortunately (I was a bit dozy following the surgery), but who made sure I was looked after during the night shift. Both were really friendly and approachable and put up with all my questions about what medicines I was taking and what they would do.  
In addition, I would also like to mention the cleaning staff - the Ward looked spotless and when my room was cleaned on the morning of my discharge, it was done with a friendly smile.  
Finally, a big thank you to Ashleigh who was the theatre nurse with me when I was wheeled into theatre. She did a great job of chatting to me and keeping my mind away from the surgery until I finally went under the anaesthetic.  
Everyone I came across was a credit to the NHS and helped ensure my first (and hopefully last) surgery went smoothly and with minimal anxiety on my part. Thank you all!

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West
NHS Grampian

author: indiahq35
title: Cognitive Behavioural Therapy
body: CBT provided by Ealing IAPT helped me overcome severe depression and anxiety. I was very lucky to get Tom as my therapist. Tom's techniques for CBT exceeded all my expectations. When I first started, I was crying. By the end, I was overwhelmed with tears of gratitude. Tom changed my life! He listened to me very carefully and identified ways to alter my thought patterns. Tom was so thorough that he even picked up on my moods and the language I used to describe events. Tom used his experience, wisdom and vast amounts of practical advice that helped me evolve within such a short timeframe. He was passionate about his knowledge and motivated me to overcome my obstacles. I didn't expect it to change my life. Tom has given me the tools to help myself and recognise potential signs of relapse. He is patient, persistent, thorough, and extremely professional. It has been a blessing to have Tom as my therapist. I will be eternally grateful. Thank you for this service.

readBy.name: West London NHS Trust

author: Lisa75
title: Made such a difference
body: My son gets IV antibiotics every 3 months. Ever since this service has been available it has made such a difference to him. He gets very anxious having to go into hospital for anything and being able to get the IV line inserted in the comfort of his own home and helped with this. It has also helped with the ease of the line going in as he is not stressed about it and much more relaxed. I cannot commend this service and the staff enough! !

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Treyj95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My experience on the orthopaedic ward
body:
I came into hospital on Friday night via the ambulance after about a 2 hr wait. I had a fall outside my house and broke my leg. The ambulance crew were very helpful and very knowledgeable. They were able to confirm that I had broken my leg by looking at it and organized for me to get transferred to Craigavon Hospital. They rang the hospital ahead so the staff were able to anticipate my arrival and get me sorted as soon as possible . I was waiting for a couple of hours at the reception but soon got a bed. I didn't really mind the wait as I was satisfied that staff were trying their best to organize a bed for me. I was X- rayed very quickly as well and this sped up the whole process of treatment. I am very happy with how quickly I was seen to which was brilliant as I was in a lot of pain. The staff did however listen to this and gave me adequate pain relief to make me feel comfortable.  
The staff on this ward have been so good. They are very pleasant and helpful and do everything and more for me. I am due to have my operation tomorrow and they have been helpful and informative with regards to the plans being put in place to allow this procedure to go ahead. I never knew how much needed checked before you can undergo surgery but the staff explained this to me so I haven't felt on edge or anxious.  
I spoke with my surgeon as well and he was very nice to speak to.  
My ward space is very comfortable and I have no complaints. The level of cleanliness is also of a high standard.  
The food is good and there is a good variety however there is a lot of it given to you and when you do not have a large appetite there is a lot that goes to waste. It also very salty and this would be my only criticism overall.

readBy.name: Northern Ireland ambulance service
Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

author: Measles
title: Great service following riding accident
body: My son had a fall from his horse cross country schooling and we couldn't be more impressed by the swift and thorough care he received. After a 15 min hold on 111 a professional yet caring woman arranged for a call back with an xray appointment. That call came through 2 mins later with an appointment in an hour's time. My son was in and out of minor injuries within 20 mins including assessment, xray and subsequent assessment and discussion. Thank you to everyone involved for a reassuring, compassionate and professional service. We couldn't be more impressed.

readBy.name: NHS 24
NHS Forth Valley

author: Fortunate Lady
title: My recent two day stay
body:
BRILLIANT EXPERIENCE  
I was initially admitted as a Day Stay Patient onto the Day Surgery Ward at Basildon University Hospital.  
I was fortunate to be under the expertise care of Mr Seferiadis & his wonderful team. The Anaesthetist (sorry I did not get his name) present at my procedure stayed with me for a full hour afterwards.  
I was then taken onto Horndon Ward to recover.  
I admit I was nervous as usual, but from the start I was put at ease.  
In fact if I had of gone private I would not have received better treatment!  
All the Staff I met during my short stay were very professional at all times.  
Hence, I have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending Mr Seferiadis.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

author: Castlerankie73
title: Smoking
body: Smoked for nearly 25 years...finally managed after support from Gill. The support and communication with her has been fantastic...at last 3 months free from cigarettes.

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley

author: Zunni
title: The staff were amazing
body: I took my dad to Tameside hospital yesterday, the staff there were amazing, from reception to triage to doctor Peter, he was kind, patient and straight to the point, made us feel at ease, to the porter who took my dad for a xray to the pharmacist to collect medication.   Everything single staff member were do helpful and patient, the hospital should be proud to have these people working with you.

readBy.name: Tameside and Glossop Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: pelicanzw74
title: Safe and well organised
body: I attended the sexual health clinic to have my implant removed. There were sanitizer stations and masks around to use, it felt safe and organised. I went straight into my appointment the nurse was lovely and we had a great chat while I had my procedure. I would highly recommend there.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: Bigfella
title: The service has been second to none
body: I would like to take this opportunity to say how efficient my local heart failure clinic in North Devon is.   I have for the last 7 years had instances of Atrial Fibrillation (AF) and this has been treated each time with Cardio Inversion (CI).   However, the time between each procedure became shorter and shorter. This year, I was told that CI was no longer an option and I was referred to the Heart Failure Clinic at Bideford.   I wasn't too impressed with the clinic name but the service I've received has been second to none. They have contacted me just to see how I'm doing and have kept an eye on my medication and implemented changes  promptly.   All I can say is, thank God for the NHS and the people work in it.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: woodpeckerhk97
title: My covid vaccine
body: Very well run with ease and felt assured and staff where so nice

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: elephantnt87
title: Distance to available services
body:
I needed to get a cardiac appointment and I live in Forfar - there were none available at Ninewells, Stracathro or Arbroath due to COVID 19 restrictions. I am a vulnerable person, suffer from anxiety and cannot take public transport and my dad who usually takes me to the appointments is unwell at moment - I have no confidence in patient transport as once they have not turned up and the other time they turned up at time of my appointment so I would have been late. So I opted to get a taxi from Forfar to Perth which cost me £120 there and back.  
As I am on disability benefits, I got an expenses form and the person I spoke to initially said I should probably get at least half back, but later phoned me to say it was only 13 pence per mile I would get back - I received a payment for £11.00 this week. I feel its riduculous as Perth Royal Infirmary was the only hospital that could do this procedure and to get there has cost me a lot. Could this be looked into as I am sure there a lot of patients who have to travel from Forfar, Arbroath etc to Perth who really cannot afford this and have to wait again. I would have waited for another appointment but this was the only place that was carrying out the test I needed.

readBy.name: NHS Tayside

author: Gumball
title: Visit to minor injuries
body:
Hello  
I had an accident and attended minor injuries at the New Queen Victoria Hospital as I wanted to check if my thumb was broken. From the moment I arrived, the lovely nurse at the door helped me with my mask, took my temperature and directed me to reception. I can’t remember his name but he wore glasses and was so kind. The lovely gentleman at reception took my details and I didn’t have to wait long before I was called through (I’m sure it was Nurse Karen who did my initial assessment)  
I had to have an X-ray and Gemma (radiologist) couldn’t have been more patient. I’m sure her name was Frances but another amazing member of the team brought me a sick bowl and cup of water as I was in so much pain and walked me back to the cubicles.  
The Nurse who gave me my splint couldn’t have been nicer either. The whole experience was fantastic from start to finish … everyone I met genuinely cared, talked to me with compassion (and humour!) and I felt compelled to recognise this. The NHS gets a lot of stick but these people are angels in human form. Utterly brilliant. Thank you SO much for taking care of me. You are THE best.

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

author: hekanj99
title: Induction and forceps delivery
body:
Induction took 3 days on the 4th day I broke my own waters and it was discovered I was 6cm dilated so I moved to the labour ward.  
Some of the midwives I found not to be gentle and from my experience I found there was an inconsistent policy about pain relief during insertion and removal of pessaries and after two days and nights of regular contractions with no sleep I asked for pain relief and was offered a paracetamol. There were two midwives who were supportive but some of the others I felt showed little support, barely any empathy and a complete lack of experience.  
My baby was born Sunday evening via emergency forcep delivery - I couldn't recommend the team who performed it highly enough, or the midwife on the actual labour ward who worked with me through - they were fantastic.  
Induction is hit or miss - but compassion goes a long way to a women going through it.

readBy.name: Royal Berkshire NHS Foundation Trust

author: waltznx78
title: Midwives all very helpful
body:
Following the birth of my baby, my time in the Maternity Department has been absolutely great.  
The midwives are all brilliant- very helpful, kind and nice. When it comes to the maternity ward itself it has also been great- dead on. I really cannot think of anything which could be improved so well done!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Rude Doctors
body:
The doctor I was assigned was incredibly rude and extremely condescending to point that I have no other option than to leave.

I have tried to book an appointment which was also very difficult

author: Suzi2021
title: Looked after us superbly
body:
I accompanied my brother today for a minor operation in the dermatology department today to remove a nasty growth. It was our first time at the hospital.  
The staff in the department was absolutely brilliant and we cannot thank them enough. They were so caring and considerate and looked after my brother and myself superbly. Thank you!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good eConsultation and phone call
body: Very good experience of using the econsult and uploaded photo with follow up phonecall to get a diagnosis, together with a prescription sorted (for where I was 300 miles away!) within minutes by admin staff. Special thank you to them. I know it is not always an easy option to use but worked very well in this instance. Thank you all very much.

title: Great Practice
body: I have been a patient for 19 years, the level of service is very high which helps make this a very busy surgery for the Doctor and receptionists, every one is very kind, helpful and professional and all have continued to support me through a lot of different family and health problems over the years which has been above and beyond for which I am thankful for.

title: Brilliant service
body: I attended a&e after my gps advice, within 20 minutes of waiting I was triaged and taken to ward 27. I was told I would need to come back for surgery the next day, the nurses were incredible, so kind and caring and really put me at ease about my surgery. I was well looked after and really appreciated the care I received. The surgery went really well, so quick and organised. Came back the next day for dressings, was seen to straight away by a lovely student nurse. The nurses and doctors really helped me so much and I am so thankful for everything they did for me.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Uncaring and Unprofessional
body:
I called for an appointment first thing to be told there were no more available, this is always the case.  So I asked if I could have a phone call or send a picture of a heated rash I had, they said no and advised I needed to go to Sheppey.  Could not get through to Sheppey so called back, they were as rude and unhelpful as always so I called 111.  111 referred my issue to Iwade who contacted me eventually and ask me to send a picture!!!  Exactly what I had asked them in the first place.  

They shut their doors during the pandemic and put extra pressure on other NHS bodies by doing this.  There is one very helpful gentleman on reception who goes above an beyond to assist. 

There never seems to be a full team of Doctors in and you can never get an appointment, outsourcing to DMC has not helped the surgery is still failing.

title: Very helpful Practice
body: I recently had to register my elderly mother with the practice as she had fallen and was staying  with me . The registration process was easy and all her medication was issued immediately. I had prompt and excellent support at a very difficult time for me

title: Excellent, caring service!
body: This is the first time I have visited the new medical centre and I was very impressed with the excellent service we received. So much so that I felt compelled to leave a review. I needed to see a Dr urgently for my toddler who had been quite unwell over the weekend. I waited 5 mins for our call to be taken, the receptionist was very helpful and gave a clear idea of when we'd get a call back from a Dr and then how quickly we'd be asked to come in for a face to face appointment if necessary. I called at 9am and we were given an appointment at 11.30. The Dr we saw was excellent and very caring with my little one. She followed up later in the day by phone to see how we were getting on. It can be worrying when your child is unwell but we received such excellent care that it made things so much less stressful.  We feel very lucky to have such a great surgery on our doorstep. Thank you!

author: intensitytz35
title: Maternity care & treatment
body:
My time on the maternity ward has been absolutely dead on. The staff have all been lovely - absolutely brilliant.  
The ward itself has been nice - it is also quite quiet which I am happy about. I haven't been in long yet but what I have seen and experienced so far has been great and I have no improvements to suggest. The care and treatment has been absolutely 5 stars.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Outstanding service
body: I have been registered at this surgery for just over a year now and I would not want to be registered anywhere else. All staff are extremely friendly and helpful, whether I’ve needed an appointment or to collect medication. Both the doctor and nurses are very welcoming and understanding of problems I have had in the past. Overall, could not ask for a better service

title: Second too none
body: I never got a chance to express my thanks to the staff at Penzance, their dedication to their patients was second to none. I have never experienced the amount of care shown by these wonderful people, going above and beyond what is asked of them. When discharged I felt I was saying goodbye to friends and not just some person who was being paid to look after someone. I will always be eternally grateful to each and every one of them.

readBy.name: Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust
Plymouth University BSc Adult Nursing 2019-09
Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

author: Bronchie
title: I felt like a weight had been lifted
body: Today I had an appointment with Emily following a recent diagnosis. Emily made me feel completely at ease and by the time I left I felt like a weight that I didn't know that I was carrying had been lifted. She gave me plenty of information in a way that I could easily understand, her advice was easy to follow and she let me know what would happen next.

readBy.name: Somerset NHS Foundation Trust

title: So helpful and efficient
body: On holiday here from Switzerland, I walked in with an ear infection. Despite being very busy, a kind doctor found 5min to have a look and prescribe me the antibiotics I needed. A ray of light in a dark world. Thank you!!!

title: Superb service from Dr Waterstone
body: Superb service from Dr Waterstone who replied to my online description & pics regarding my ailment so quickly that I failed to answer my phone until she'd tried twice more! Within five mins of me submitting my forms, she'd worked out that my finger wasn't broken but infected & organised for antibiotics to be sent through to my local pharmacy. First class!

author: saabman93
title: Visit to A&E
body: Telephoned first this morning and was told to go to A & E and was sent to minor injuries. On arrival there i was asked why did I not contact my GP first, and phone first is not the best idea. Maybe the member of staff was not happy with the process. The only other complaint was the distant required to walk to ED X-ray was very long. Other than that the visit was good.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: plushr75
title: Staff all extremely pleasant and lovely
body: I am now feeling much better following my stay in the female medical ward.   All the staff, doctors and nurses included, have been very very good - extremely pleasant and lovely - they really would do anything for you.   The ward itself has also been very good - I have no improvements to offer so keep up the good work.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Horrendous
body:
I moved to this surgery earlier this year and in my experience, the service has been nothing short of farcical each time I have had to contact them. Horrendous telephone queues every time; for example, I’ve been in a queue for over half an hour on three occasions before hanging up. 

The chemist sat on the phone for 20 mins waiting to be connected on my behalf once using the ‘medical professional’ extension. 

The GP prescribed a drug over 12 times the dose of the one I should have had. 

I’ve ordered prescriptions online that have been cancelled without explanation. 

The root cause in all of the issues I’ve experienced is poor communication between the clinical staff and those being asked to handle calls. 

(Nearly) everyone is pleasant when you get through, it’s just getting there is beyond a joke. Often when I’ve spoken to reception staff, they tell me they’ll write down my query, and then I’m then advised to call back in 48 hours to check anything has been done…which invariably it hasn’t. 

So, yeah. Not a great experience in the six months I’ve been registered here. And they still don’t have my previous medical records, despite my previous GP assuring me they’d done their part of the transfer back in February.

title: Amazing care
body: I was taken here for the first time,by ambulance as was the nearest hospital to where I was. I was a bit hesitant to go there seeing as I was only used to being treated at North Middlesex Hospital but I was glad I did. The a and e department staff were all amazing. They did their utmost best to relieve my intense pain and anxiety which went on for hours. I kept being reassured and listened to. Even though I was extremely, bordering on impossible, hard to get a line into they did their very best and eventually got a line into my arm. I was later transferred to a ward where I was seen by the pain team and hooked up to a PCA. I was treated with enough pain medication, antibiotics and tlc as much as possible.Even when the pca stopped working because my cannula tissued the doctor made sure I was still being given enough pain relief, antisickness and antibiotics orally and subcutaneously to manage my sickle crisis until they could get another line in me. One time the kitchen accidentally missed me for lunch and one of the care worker, whose name I'm unfortunately not allowed to mention, rapidly offered to get me something to eat from the shop in the hospital with her own money. I mentioned a drink and a snack and she came back with a whole bag worth of snacks and drinks and even a hot food. I was so impressed and touched I almost cried. I couldn't thank her enough. On the day of my discharge the ward manager and other staff  were so attentive to my needs and kept asking if I felt well enough to be discharged and I assured them I was. One of my tta's was missing and they offered to clarify that for me immediately and I could get it the next day which I was okay with. The ward manager even walked me down to the taxi picking me up and made sure I was comfortable. I praise every single one of the nurses, doctors, hca's and ward managers that tended to me. I highly recommend this hospital to anyone. Fatima I

readBy.name: Princess Alexandra Hospital NHS Trust

title: Systems are failing badly
body:
My husband went to collect a prescription today for me and there was one person on Reception. He waited in a queue for the best part of half an hour, & overheard the couple in front of him complaining to each other that they’d come into the surgery to make an appointment as there were 40 people in the telephone queue (approx 90 min wait) so it was quicker to visit than it was to wait on the phone. When my husband finally got to speak to the person on Reception they looked for the prescription (and even enlisted members of the Prescription team to help) for a considerable time before realising that they had been looking for it under my first name & not my surname. 

This pretty much typifies the problems with this surgery at the moment. I have had a situation recently where I’ve had to bypass the surgery &  self-refer my daughter for physio because her e-consult was triaged by a receptionist NOT a clinician, & she was given a phone appointment for three weeks later for increasing upper back pain (she is 7). A GP then phoned the following day to say that they were having to check how the receptionist had triaged cases, to ensure that those who needed to be spoken to urgently didn’t slip through the net - a massive waste of time and effort! I understand that the practice of receptionist triaging has now been stopped, but it’s pretty alarming that it even started to be honest.

Over the past three or four months I have had:

Reception respond to my e-consult by sending me a curt message telling to go & buy my own medication, when I’d specifically spent 20 minutes filling the form in so that I could get it on my prescription prepayment certificate. I then phoned the practice & was told to send an online message to Reception about it, but it was a Thursday & as I got no response on the Friday I was left in pain all weekend without the medication I needed. 

I have had a smear cancelled & been told to phone the surgery to rebook when it takes 45 minutes to get through at the quietest time of the day, to then have a 2 min rebooking conversation.

I have been told via a message from the Prescriptions team to buy my own medication over the counter when I had requested my usual repeat prescription of it.

I tried to call the surgery this morning & instead of being put into the queue I was cut off. Three times. I had to phone NHS111 who told the surgery I needed an urgent phone call.

I realise Covid has created many problems, but my parents’ surgery in Derbyshire is efficient & timely, & is everything that Aspen is not. My Dad was a director in a major hospital for a number of years, & he is appalled by the service and standard of care we (& neighbours & friends as well to be honest) have been receiving from Aspen. 

I realise that after submitting this review, Aspen Medical Practice will suggest that I put in a complaint via their website. I would - except that I honestly don’t think it will make the slightest bit of difference to the systems in place.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Advice
body: Admitted day case unit had a hysterscopy with anaesthetic was told I would be informed on findings when asked I was told surgeon had gone home and I could go home but there was no discharge papers as they be lost feeling very anxious as ii wasnt told anything or what to do at home if I had problems after the hysterscopy

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service and very helpful
body: My Mam and I visited the surgery yesterday. The young man on Reception was very polite and helpful when checking in. So nice to see a smiling face as the first point of call. We both had an appointment with the HCA who fully explained fully the procedures she was going to carry out. Appointments went extremely well and it was lovely that she took the time to ensure that we were happy with the service, a really lovely lady. Well done and thank you to you both for all your help.

title: Amazing care
body: I attended the orthopaedics department with my baby daughter who had hip dysplasia and I can only say the care given to her by the specialist physio and her team was beyond outstanding- my daughter would not have competed her treatment so successfully if the specialist and her team weren’t so committed and had belief that her treatment would work. I can’t say how grateful I am, they made a scary experience so much easier.

readBy.name: Alder Hey Children's NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor customer service
body: I brought my daughter to the A&E section suffering from extreme abdominal cramps. 5 hours later we are still waiting. This is a poor show on the part of the hospital. While I totally understand that there may be few doctors on duty, surely the service could be better. Very disappointing indeed.

readBy.name: North Middlesex University Hospital NHS Trust

title: Great staff that really care
body:
I’ve been here several times with work, but unfortunately was injured myself this time, the staff here are excellent make you feel calm and reassured that they know what they’re doing. 

Over the years I’ve been here many times from a child to an adult the care and service that is received is second to none. They always go above and beyond to support you.

readBy.name: East Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Avoid at all costs
body: Unable to book appointment online. Their procedure is to triage everyone via an online lodgement system that will only respond after 48 hours and which is not operative outside of clinic hours (I can understand if the response is immediate and so will need to be when the clinic is open but if the response is delayed surely it is a matter of the clinic nurse reading the lodged cases when they get in?). Covid or not, this clinic has persistently make you jump through hoops to see or talk to anyone. Do not register with them if you are looking for actual medical help. Avoid at all cost, unless you fancy going to the A&E each time you need to see a doctor.

title: Totally disorganized
body:
I had to ring 188 times just to get through to book an appointment. Then when I managed to speak with someone, all the available slots for the day were gone. I'd book for the following day you think? No can do: poor management lets only book for the current day, while before it was possible to book up to 2 weeks in advance. 
There is no excuse for this, but they justify it with covid issues (that clearly doesn't have anything to do with poor booking management systems).

author: Skeet
title: Several hours before an ambulance arrived
body:
I live an hour away from my mother and made my why to the location she had taken a fall. Fortunately, a retired nurse and off duty nurse were at the same location and had made her comfortable as they suspected she had broken her hip.  
She lay on the ground where she had fallen for 4 hours before an ambulance arrived and after the NIAS service being rang again on 2 separate occasions from the initial 999 call.  
On ringing the hospital the NIAS crew told me they were taking my mother to I found out she had been transferred in the early hours of the morning to another hospital.  
On locating where my mother had been brought to the hospital/ward in question updated me as to her current position, but I was still ‘none the wiser’ as to what was taking place. I was also then informed that due to current C19 levels, 1 visitor per week, for 1 hour.  
That same evening my mother tried to ring me, but it was evident that due to the sedation she was receiving she was totally out of it. My wife tried to listen into the conversation, but we could not understand anything she was trying to say to us.  
During this current pandemic this is the third time my mother has been hospitalized but each time before we have been able to communicate via Face Time but after the conversation we had I knew that on this occasion this may not be possible.  
Whoever has thought of this initiative and those who are providing it deserve a very big thank you. On ringing and speaking to Patient Liaison Services the process was well explained. Then on receiving the link via email the link was easily downloaded, the agent we spoke to on connecting at the start of the call was very helpful and the agent who set with my mother whilst we conducted the call was excellent. Anytime we asked a question my mother was not able to answer she went and got an answer from a nurse.  
This service is very useful and a big thank you to all those involved.

readBy.name: Northern Ireland ambulance service
Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Gone to the Dogs
body: This Practice has gone to the dogs over the past 12-18 months or so and whilst it would be easy to blame covid for this, the fact is its down to the management and GP's. No one has a clue. There is a lack of ownership and responsibility. A lack of empathy. A lack of staff. So many staff seem to have left. I believe this Practice joined other local Practices in some sort of merger a couple of years ago and the service is unrecognisable now to what it once was. Most of the old team have left and been replaced by poor substitutes. This used to be a fantastic Practice that the residents and patients of Silsden were proud of, with staff that cared, GP's that were accessible, management that welcomed feedback. They were always willing to listen and engage. Now the residents and patients are treated with disdain when we try to access services and fobbed off. No doubt covid will be blamed but its not. Other Practices I know of have continued to deliver far better services in covid. If there was another local Practice I could join I would, but there isn't. I'm stuck with this shambles. And many friends and neighbours feel the same.

title: Fantastic NHS service given
body: Great Dr and Admin staff. I left Kent for Scotland and the only thing I miss is my GP surgery! All caring, patient, friendly and can’t do enough to help you. The care I have been given has been first class. Even in the covid times they have always worked hard to keep a caring consistent service going. Thank you all

author: sculptorqq36
title: Wonderful care received
body: Large cut in left thumb, arrived at Stirling minor injuries and was seen by Tracey. Excellent level of service received

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley

author: trappercb79
title: Amazing staff
body: Had a lovely nurse who helped me give some blood for a test and also recommended I get a vaccine. So I did, there and then, all sorted, really helpful and friendly nurse. Thank you

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

title: Can't thank them enough!
body: I have been at corner place for years and my children. They have been amazing and more recently, they have really been fantastic. I have felt listened too and treated with kindness and empathy. Despite the difficulties during the pandemic I've always felt 100% confident in their treatment of me and my concerns. Thankyou so much, to the whole team!

title: Covid Vaccination
body: Thank you to all the staff and volunteers at Rowcroft this Saturday 7th August. The organisers, admins, marshals, nurses, doctors, seemingly ex-retireees (apologies for the offence if this is not true!!) were the friendliest group people I've encountered. Excellently run programme, thanks to you all (in spite of this government!) for being so dedicated to helping us all in these scary times. Best wishes to you all.

author: Karen1972
title: Coil removal and replace
body: Routine procedure. The doctor and nurse were very informative and friendly which helped me relax. I was initially put off when I found it was a male doctor but he was really good and made me feel very comfortable.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

title: Absolute joke
body:
They tell you to ring at 8, but you ca t get through, on some occasions I've called over 200 times. This morning I needed to see a doctor, called 103 times but could t get through so went down to the surgery only to be told "Ive booked you a telephone appointment and the doctor will tell you if you need to come in"
I'm stood there in front of her in an empty surgery.... Why couldn't anyone see me there and then?! Even a nurse!

title: Don’t bother
body: Impossible to get an appointment, have been trying for a couple of days now. Wasn’t classed as a medical emergency, was told only appts only if it’s life threatening. Isn’t that what 999 is for? Have been with this surgery since 1999, it used to be brilliant unfortunately it’s been steadily going downhill for a number of years.

title: Great practice
body: Always friendly staff" will sort any problems out for you. Waiting times in my appointments have always been ok. Clean and great staff.

title: Lethargy and a Lack of Concern
body:
3 Aug 21, head trauma, admitted to the Northern General Hospital (NGH). 4 Aug 21, discharged.

I monitored my localised headache, and, as it had not improved, I called my local GP on 9 Aug 21, who strongly advised to go to an A&E dept, so I went back to NGH. My start and end times are accurate, all other times are close approximations.

Breakfast finished by 6.30, and on completion of household tasks, I set off for hospital at 9.30 am, arriving at 10.45 to start a long wait in the queue into A&E. I fully appreciate many people had put off long-standing aches and pains during the pandemic, so I expected a delay.

I was registered at ca. 11.30, and then had to wait in the A&E waiting area for a minimum of 1 hour for triage. I was seen in triage at ca. 1.00 pm, and then had to wait again until called forward for examination. At ca. 3.00 pm, a junior doctor found no external signs of concern, but thought the continuing headache warranted a CT scan. I had to wait again to be advised accordingly after she spoke to her superior. 

At ca. 3.20, the doctor took me to the CT scan area (she didn't know her way around, so she asked other staff how to get there). After almost an hour watching other patients being wheeled in and out, I asked a staff member to confirm they had me on their list. They didn't...! I had been transferred to the scan area but not booked in...! They apologised and pledged to get me in straight away. 20 minutes later, I had the scan, lasting approximately 3 minutes, and then returned to A&E at ca. 4.45 pm to await the results.

I had had nothing to eat since 6.30 am.

At ca. 5.30 pm, I asked the same doctor why the results were taking so long. She said she would look into it. At 6.30 pm, I asked again, and was then guided by another staff member to the CDU waiting area to receive my results. At 6.45 pm, as staff changeover was about to take place, I asked the senior member (before she was about to leave) for an update on my scan results. She simply said, they haven't been sent up yet. 

As new staff took over, I advised reception that I had already spent eight hours in the hospital and that it was now over twelve hours since I had eaten anything. They said they would look into my scan results. At 7.15 pm, I went back to reception and advised them that this whole situation was now ridiculous. Had anyone actually contacted the scan dept at any stage to expedite my results? 

At 7.45 pm, I called for the senior staff member to advise him that having received a 5-minute triage, a 6-minute examination and a 3-minute CT scan, it was inconceivable that I needed to be in the hospital for a total of 9 hours. Over two-and-a-half hours after the scan, there was no sign of the results, nor any urgency in expediting them, so I had no option but to discharge myself. 

I got home 12 hours after leaving, and I still do not have the results of my scan...!

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Healthwatch Sheffield

title: Terrible Service
body:
Late delivery of medication, almost impossible to contact, do not answer email and unable to contact nursing team.

My medication was 2 weeks late being delivered. Was told a nurse would contact me to arrange a visit, have waited another 10 days and still no contact.

I have tried called only to be told “please hang up” as my call is about a nurse visit.

I have emailed several times and still no response.

As a result of this poor service my condition is getting worse.

title: no appointments
body: may as well not have a doctors in the village as it's not possible to get an appointment.phoned lots of times at 8am the only time appointments are are avaiable and it's not possible to get through if you do no appointments left .you could die before getting through.

title: Interpersonal skills poor
body: Trying to contact Living Care by phone is a nightmare you just can’t get through unless you are prepared to wait for some considerable time. This was the first of 2 issues. The second issue was when I went for my procedure I was very anxious.  instead of putting me at ease the doctor was very abrupt and questioned me in a very condescending way almost implying I was wasting his time and said things to me like ‘ Why am I doing this?’ I said it was at the request of my consultant but he continued this line of questioning at which point I told him he should’ve spoken to my consultant. He was rude not empathic and in my view if he had any queries about the NHS referral to Living Care he should’ve have addressed these in the weeks prior to the appointment with my consultant. I have never been treated like this by the NHS.  I think Living Care as a private company doing work on behalf of the NHS need to up their game in terms of patient care and communication. I felt upset and even more anxious due to this interaction.

title: Dreadful Appointment System
body: The Doctors and all staff here are great, but…Can you PLEASE change your appointments system as a priority. So many people going unseen. I understand that the Surgery is probably flooded with requests but there has to be a better way. Trying to get even a phone consultation is a feat in itself, that’s when you can even get through at 8am. Other Surgeries are busy too, but have managed to adapt. This untenable appointment system must be stressful for your staff as well as us, the patients.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Tameside

title: Exceptional
body:
Taken into A&E on Saturday then to the Acute ward and on to Cardiology. Exceptional in all area. All staff are amazing, committed and caring, kept me fully informed and as comfortable as possible. Facilities excellent
Well done and a sincere Thank You to all

readBy.name: North Cheshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Highly recommend
body: I havevbeen registered here for some years now. Most of the Gp's here are very tuned in and attentive, with one or two exceptions. Staff are generally helpful and supportive. Receptionists, as with Gp's generally very good their jobs and very polite and helpful. Through corona virus the practice has offered telephone call appointments, with or without video as required. There are always exceptions, but generally the practice is to be recommended. Thanks you for you hard work and dedication throught the recent difficulties.

title: Impossible appointments system
body: I have been trying for three days to get an appointment. The phones are constantly indicating busy from 08.00am and there is no back up method of contact (email address omitted from website). I have been redialling all morning without any success. Three weeks ago I had the same problem and eventually got through and the doctor (locum) rang me back late afternoon. When I complained he said that was just the way the practice organised appointments now and that everybody was complaining! This is not good enough. Health care needs to be accessible and it is no good hiding behind the Covid excuse - after 18 months of Coronavirus a better system should be in place. I cannot even complain directly to the practice as there is no method of contact except the phone - which they do not answer!

author: gs2045
title: Pass the problem
body:
At the beginning of August at 23-00hrs (11pm) I attended A&E again after advice from out of hours,  
I left in the early hours of the morning having had a ct scan again it came back clear,  
I had a fit at the end of July and had head pain ever since and again no tablets on this visit, to ease the head pain.  
The service was considering the amount people in acceptable but they let it down again.  
Been referred but that takes time and meanwhile I got to suffer.  
This is not a complaint or criticism of the service but why let a patient with head pain or headache suffer for over two weeks knowing the head wound they had after the fit.  
This is my second visit with the same I'm living now in pain 24/7 thanks to this.  
It's getting to the point now of not wanting any help because I feel you are just a name and number and passed as such.  
Not happy having to suffer but this is not a complaint anything but, more frustrating than anything else,

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Terrible Company
body: Absolutely awful company and I mean company as they are not a GP Surgery. Patients are treated like commodities rather than people needing help and advise. Contacting them is so difficult and time consuming, it can take days unless you can repeatedly ring. When you do get through to discuss it is treated as telephone inquiry and someone will ring my back. Or you can email brilliant!! My family and extended family will all be looking else where. Terrible.

title: Asked for a physical appointment to see doctor,…
body: Received a text message this morning from GP surgery asking me to make appointment to discuss test results. I phoned and was advised that the 3 available appointments today have already gone, (9:30am). So they tried to transfer me to reception, it rang for a few minutes but then i was cut off. I called back to the 'other queries' options and explained the situation. Was advised that you cannot go straight to 'seeing a doctor' anymore, you have to have a telephone call first. I explained that the doctor would need to be able see and touch my spine, but apparently there is this new process where you can't see a doctor, until you have spoken to a doctor to explain why you need to see a doctor. This is a total waste of an appointment (which isn't for two weeks, because they only discuss test results on certain days). I'm feeling completely let down by the whole staff at this surgery. I'm in chronic pain (which is why I was referred for the scan), the result is  'abnormal'. But it's okay, because the new process understands that you don't need to see a doctor until a doctor has spoken to you first. Wasting everyone's time and resources.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: MRI DEPARTMENT
body:
This was my first experience being a patient, I have previously accompanied both my late son and daughter when they needed scans. I recall the kindness & care involved.

On entry the reception was extremely tense, not improved by a nurse arriving with a pair of disposable gloves for me to remove jewellery, It was extremely undignified & intimidating being told that the metal would be ripped from my body by the machine whilst I’m in reception with my dress up, trying to remove it a gold (non-magnetic) belly ring. I wasn’t offered use of changing cubicles until I was taken through! That would have been a more appropriate option.

I struggle with anxiety & panic attacks in enclosed situations & mentioned this to the nurse. This fell upon deaf ears, there was more concern with platinum (not magnetic) ear bars I was having difficulty removing. The radiographers manner was cold, dismissive & you could cut the atmosphere between them with a knife. 
I have learnt that anything not stainless steel can in theory remain if it proves difficult to remove & a magnet can confirm this. He refused to allow a magnet test when the nurse asked twice, just said they’re coming out!

The radiographer conducting the procedure was extremely brusk, aloof & cold whilst I felt overwhelmed and frightened. The nurse at one point offered me a tissue saying that she could see I was getting upset. He wanted the procedure dealt with as quickly as possible, without empathy. Nothing was explained to me in any detail, any questions I asked were dismissed monosyllabically, it was extremely upsetting.

I asked about the face mask,  it contained a metal wire, I was told that was fine. Only to research later that metal wired masks should not be worn because they can cause burning to the bridge of the nose.  

I asked procedure length & was met with a vague, 20 to 30 minute dismissive answer. At no point was I offered any music to help the situation so the loud machine noise was constant & anxiety making. My kids listened to music during their MRI 

This situation could have been avoided if the team had shown compassion, empathy & understanding. But it seemed to me that they needed to get me in & out as quickly as possible especially as apparently the lady before me was late which had a knock on effect. The radiographer in question was particularly uncaring & unhelpful, maybe this wasn’t helped be me being his last appointment of the day. Even the nurse showing me out apologised to me about everything & said, you probably just want to go as quickly as possible don’t you

Whilst I do understand the concerns regarding jewellery, there is no excuse for insensitivity towards a patient who was feeling anxious & vulnerable. I should not have to walk out of there shaking & in tears, feeling traumatised. It is grossly unacceptable & unfair, especially in a private hospital where patient care is one of the top priorities. That should also include mental well-being I would have thought.

readBy.name: BMI Healthcare Ltd

title: Wonderful, supportive treatment
body: I attended the Royal Surrey as an outpatient for a gynaecological procedure - hysteroscopy. The door staff and others who saw me trying to figure out where to go were proactive and helpful. When I went in for my treatment the doctor and nurses were fantastic. They warmly welcomed me which makes a difference in boosting confidence about a procedure I was worried about. The doctor asks questions, listened actively and explained what he could do and what options were. We agreed to go forward. Heaps of support from him and the nurses throughout the procedure - telling me I was doing well, was being brave, and to breathe. Those things make a big difference. The doctor explained what he was doing and gave me the option as to whether or not to remove a polyp he found. I said yes as I knew the team would help me get through it. Afterwards I was given time to gain my composure - no rush. The doctor explained and showed me pictures of everything. As unpleasant as the procedure was the experience was VERY pleasant. I cannot thank the team enough.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic Practise
body:
I have a heart problem and the Staff in this practice could not have been more helpful The reception staff were always courteous and extremely helpful The Doctors always rang me when they said they would The Nursing staff carried out blood tests and ECG when needed
I could not have wished for better care
And all this during a pandemic! Well done all of you.

title: Incompetent
body:
have been  trying for a year to get a gp appointment.  When I had one in June, following the intervention of nurse, at diabetic review.   Gp ordered a echo. test on heart.  Two months later, I received a phone call to say he had not asked for one but "i" had to go on a website to arrange appointment. 

Now will get notice of appointment  by 20 August, and wait for test is 24 weeks.  So by time I get test it will been months from 1st phone call.  Now in pain, so I'll end up waiting in A&e.

This practice previously had 6+ good full time GP's, so always 3 doctors in building. now all gone.  Now only one doctor on site, some of the time, so know appointments. Local health authority needs to vote this practice asno longer fitfor purpose.

title: Exasperated
body: Despite many bad reviews and many patients unable to get access NOTHING has changed. Patients expected to spend HOURS waiting in phone queue. NO OTHER ACCESS. wondering what it will take to get a proper service? CQC? Local councillor? Local MP?

title: Simply the Best
body: Gold goes to Swan St Surgery Petersfield. The 2020 Olympics may be over but this Surgery has always, and continues to, deliver a world class service: patient led and a staff who immediately have true Empathy - they deliver results in an incredibly supportive way. A patient for many years they have supported me particularly during my bladder cancer journey (RC Mar 18) and more recently testing positive for Covid and a serious UTI - they were always there and gave me a confidence and morale boost. The "Virtual Ward" was a revelation, above all it allowed me to be in my bed but with a Team available - incredibly important and the Team members I spoke to gave me a serious morale boost. "Patient led" says it all, coupled with always being treated in a caring, individual way and I felt a sense of relief when speaking to them - these are the companions for any journey and this "positivity" has percolated throughout their Team at Swan St Petersfield. A candle burns for each of them. Thank You.

author: Kara Zor-El
title: The birth of our new baby boy and the aftercare received.
body:
We would like to take this opportunity to express our deepest gratitude to the staff of the Royal Victoria Hospital and in particular to those of Johnstone House .  
We were having our first child and were full of excitement, anxiety and the whole spectrum of other emotions typically associated with such an occasion. The anaesthetists, obstetrician and entire nursing, midwifery and health care support staff expertly delivered our baby and the recovery area midwives were wonderfully attentive and supportive allowing precious bonding moments while ensuring the safety of both mother and baby.  
We must highlight specific praise for the Johnstone House team brilliantly led by Ward Sister Yvonne. The highly specialised individualised care was amazingly dovetailed with empathy , experience and understanding. We will never forget Yvonne and her fantastic staff for providing the optimal environment for the first hours and days of our little boy’s life .  
Thank you.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Organised, professional and effective
body: My procedure was booked, initiated and delivered on the agreed date and time. It was also completed with no issues in about 15 minutes

author: Happy74
title: Kind and thoughtful care for my hip replacement
body:
I was admitted for hip replacement. I was very anxious on arrival but was put at ease by Mr Holt the registrar, who was extremely kind.  
I was taken good care of in the ward. Nothing was too much trouble. The ward was very clean and the meals were acceptable.  
The staff were so kind and thoughtful even to the point of getting me a warm blanket before surgery. Thankyou so much.

readBy.name: NHS Ayrshire & Arran

title: An amazing team
body: In my experience the team and especially the nursing team are amazingly supportive and truly caring in their job. With both myself and my grandson ( both haveHaemophillia ) we have experienced amazing dedication from the nursing team going out of their way to offer nursing support and administering ’factor’ when required even if it takes them over their working day, truly over and above the call of duty. It is with a great deal of appreciation and thanks I write this.

title: No compassion for patient
body: I have been on call to the surgery since 8:00am and placed on hold for 45 minutes (which may be understandable given the current circumstances.) When the phone was eventually answered I was greeted by a very rude, unpleasant member of staff! When I explained I was making an appointment for my 98 year old mother she replied by saying you need to book online, to which I  replied that would be difficult presently as I do not have access to the internet (being at my mums house). She then replied by saying well ask your children to help and I replied by informing her my children are at work and won’t be back until later. She ended the call by concluding that I need to call tomorrow morning for an appointment. To which I am surprised as to why I couldn’t book an appointment today! She was rude and had no compassion for patient wellbeing or care! She didn’t once check what the appointment was for and weather or not the patient was in need of urgent medical assistance! The surgery has a very poor reputation amongst the community due to the rudeness of the receptionist.

title: Bad service
body: I had a introductory telephone appointment with Ealing Iapt in June as I was feeling severely depressed, it took them 2 months to reach out to me again for a second appointment within that space of time I could have done something terrible to myself as I was in a bad place. It is extremely shocking that they randomly contacted me after 2 months and I am very annoyed and unhappy with the quality of the service.

readBy.name: West London NHS Trust

title: Terrible booking system
body: I have just spent 2hours getting through to a receptionist only to be told that there are are no appointments to be had. The advice was to book through the NHS app which is wrongly named on the interminable message played over and over again when you are holding on, there are never any next day appts on this app or go to walk in centre and spend another couple of hours waiting or queue outside the surgery at 8am. The last time I did this I had to queue from 7am in order to get an appointment. However if you do manage to get an appointment I have found the service to be very good and the reception staff helpful. It is very disappointing as I have been a patient for nearly 30 years and this used to be an excellent practice. I understand that years of underfunding had taken their toll even before Covid, but you must be able to do better than this. It is causing so much stress.

title: How do you get an appointment?
body: I was so excited when I realised that I could book an appointment on the NHS app to be triaged by a GP instead of the usual debacle when trying to make an appointment by phone.
